Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D with the following transformation: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.3, 0.0] Extrude the sketch by 0.3 units to create the 3D body. Part 2: Three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.15, 0.0, 0.225] Next, create the 2D sketch on the XY plane of the new coordinate system, which includes: * Face 1 consists of one loop, which includes: + Line 1: Starting from point [0.0, 0.225], ending at point [0.4313, 0.225] + Line 2: Starting from point [0.4313, 0.225], ending at point [0.45, 0.225] + Arc 1: Starting from point [0.45, 0.225], through the midpoint at [0.225, 0.0], ending at point [0.0, 0.225] Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.45. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D with the following transformation: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.15, 0.0, 0.225] Extrude the sketch by 0.0 units along the normal and 0.3 units in the opposite direction of the normal to create the 3D body with a cylindrical hole in the center. The final CAD shape will be the combination of the above intermediate shapes with a curved top edge, having dimensions of approximately 10 units in length, 5 units in width, and 3 units in height with a cylindrical hole centered along the vertical axis of the prism, having a diameter of approximately 2 units.</description>
